title: adamadnan392
author: adamadnan392
content: Hey everyone. I'm Adam, a new user here. Before joining in this forum I heard about it too many times in social media. Recently I've paid my visit here.I've noticed several boards and topics here. I've seen some interesting discussions here, some great person helping one another about their problems, some post are very educative. Another interesting thing I've noticed here is grading users rank.Thus I've influenced and joined here to know and to serve knowledge. I hope it is a great starting. Really it is an interesting forum.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: This is a forum where many users are posting daily and discussing on what going on about bitcoin, crypto and many other things like economics, altcoins, politics and society, being on this forum will never be a waste of time if you want to learn and help others. You can go to meta by following that link which is what is about this forum, start reading the pinned threads about the forum rules and what others to know about like merit and activity.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=24.0

comments.author: crwth
comments.body: Welcome to the forum. You should read the stickied on the beginners & help section, where you posted this, and learn how it works around here. Usually, that's how it should be so you would know how and what the forum is for, how you can get adjusted, and what resources you need to read out there.You can start here if you like. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.0You can also share "how" you got into BTCT, how you discovered it, and why it showed you on social media.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Welcome to the forum. If you want to keep up with the times, then the forum will be a good ally for this. Start learning about bitcoin. Knowledge builds confidence in the future. Don't stop improving yourself, even if you think you're already well-educated.Ask, read, and learn how to use the search. This will make your journey through the forum easier.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5276341.0

comments.author: Daniel91
comments.body: Welcome to the forum Adam.I agree, this forum is a great place to learn the basics of crypto and bitcoin.I suggest you to start here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1631151.0If you have more questions after that, feel free to ask your questions, and older and more experienced forum members will be happy to answer you.Yes, on this forum we have different forum ranks based on activity and number of merits.As you gain more knowledge and experience about crypto, you will slowly progress on this forum and later be able to help new members of this forum.I'm glad you decided to join this forum and learn something new

comments.author: dimonstration
comments.body: Welcome to the Bitcointalk Fam! We are a family here sharing knowledge, helping each other and sometimes make some fight but we are all united here despite our differences.Just remember to read the forum rules before you made post. Don’t become a spam poster and merit beggar just to increase your rank quickly. Focus on what you are good at and contribute on it. Don’t push yourself on topic that you don’t like because you will just spamming the forum with nonsense post if you don’t what you’re saying.Lastly, Be safe! Use the trust score on user profile here to determine the reputation of that person before you will deal to anyone here.

comments.author: JoyMarsha
comments.body: Welcome to the forum Adam. This is a good place to be if you want to know everything about crypto. Although there are other crypto-related forums but this forum of ours stands out as the best of them all. There are a few things you should be aware of as a new member of this community. There is a rule that controls it. Learn more about this here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0 to avoid doing something that the community is vehemently opposed to.

comments.author: 2stout
comments.body: You are in the best place to learn about Bitcoin specifically and cryptocurrency in general and I mean everything.  Welcome, enjoy, there is a plethora of information here, continue to remain vigilant.

comments.author: meser#
comments.body: It's nice to see you in here Adam. Its one of the best place find out what cryptocurrencies really are. The thing that makes this place special to me is that you will find an atmosphere of friendship, family, conversation, whatever you call it. Unless you use it with bad intentions. Forum members will help you with your problems, they will add knowledge and value to you. As you repay these supports to community back, you will rise in what you call ranking in the forum. I suggest you to review the topics and boards suggested by other members. Then step by step you will move on mate. Keep going without giving up

comments.author: CryptoPanda
comments.body: Welcome to bitcointalk Adam. Beginners and help section is the best place to get started. Read the sticky threads so you know the dos and don’ts of the forum. You will more educating material as you spend more time here. Don’t be shy to participate in discussions regardless of rank. It’s good to know bitcointalk is getting some publicity on social media, though I think we could do better with the Bitcointalkshow on YouTube. Quote from: adamadnan392 on December 03, 2022, 11:49:19 AMAnother interesting thing I've noticed here is grading users rank.All you need to know about merit and ranksRank & acctivity: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=178608.msg1861412#msg1861412merit system: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2818350.msg28856522#msg28856522

comments.author: Issa56
comments.body: You are welcome to the forum and you should have mentioned your name, let's keep everything anonymous.I think the first thing to do is go through the forum rules, try and understand the rules before posting so that you won't go against the rules, actually the rules are not really harsh.secondly you should have the mindset of learning from this forum and not to make money, if your main aim is to make money them you might later be doing things that will be against the forum rules, like begging for merits or posting just for merits sake and you might endup plagiarizing which is a great offense in the forum, but if you post just because you want to learn or you want to make impact to the forum, then definitely you are going to be receiving merit and you will rank up.

Really it is an interesting forum.I find it very interesting that you heard this forum from social media! I guess that the popularity of cryptocurrencies have skyrocketed in the past years given that this forum is relatively famous. Anyway, congratulations on starting your journey here, OP!Yes you are right- there are forum ranks present but they are used primarily for signature campaigns. A forum rank does not entirely determine if a person is trustworthy or not, so exercise your discretion well if you are planning on investing and someone messages you visiting some shady links, etc.If you do not know anything about cryptocurrencies, then this is the best place for you start. I also recommend watching various guides in YouTube in order to understand and get an overall grasp on how cryptocurrencies work.

comments.author: Pandu Geddon
comments.body: welcome to the forum buddy. I hope you feel at home in this forum. much that you can find and discuss here. but before that, maybe you can study the forum rules to stay on track.My advice, try to find a topic that you are interested in it. such as trading discussions, bitcoin discussions, mining, or even gambling.when you discuss what you are interested in and know, it will be more fun and you can feel more at home in the forum.have a nice day.

comments.author: coupable
comments.created_time: December 05, 2022, 11:35:33 PMLast edit: December 08, 2022, 10:36:06 PM by coupable
comments.body: I do not find it strange that a new visitor finds that the forum seems boring, and from its main interface it appears full of messy topics. There is really no incentive to stay at first sight. In the beginning, it requires some passion and curiosity, and perhaps users who are accustomed to communicating with others on forums can distinguish the different elements and integrate with them easily. And with more time spent on the forum, that passion will become accustomed, and it will become much easier to navigate between sections of the forum.

comments.author: Razmirraz
comments.body: Everyone has welcomed your presence here with open arms, some of the Seniors have also pointed you to topics that can help you start your journey in the forum. Try getting involved in some discussions on more recent topics which can give you valuable leads. Remember, to reach a higher rank requires a process, the seniors who are still active here also need a process from a lower rank when they join the forum.Even though at that time (before the merit system was implemented) at least there was a target for calculating the number of posts and activities as the stages that must be passed to be promoted to a higher rank. Now (after the merit system is in effect) the rank up process is not as easy as before (it don't mean you can't Rank Up), you are required to have the capital (knowledge) to reach a new rank.
